data.title: Central Piedmont Community College
data.text: Description 1 videodisc (approximately 97 min.) : DVD video, sound, color with black & white sequences ; 4 3/4 in. digital optical surround Dolby Digital 5.1 rda digital optical stereo Dolby Digital 2.0 rda laser optical NTSC rda video file DVD video region 1 rda System Details DVD; NTSC, region 1; Dolby digital 5.1 surround, 2.0 stereo. Performer Interviewers, Amy Ziering, Kirby Dick. Credits Cinematography, Thaddeus Wadleigh, Kirsten Johnson ; editors, Doug Blush, Derek Boonstra ; "Need someone" performed by Mary J. Blige. Note Originally released as a motion picture in 2012. Audience Rating: Not rated. Summary A groundbreaking investigative documentary about the epidemic of rape within the U.S. military. Follows the stories of several idealistic young servicewomen who were raped and then betrayed by their own officers when they courageously came forward to report. Contents Dream come true -- Nobody saved me -- Silent statistics -- Witch hunting -- Veterans day -- Target-rich environment -- Investigation -- Government of one -- Breaking the bond -- Lawsuit for justice -- Stopping the tradition -- Shared challenge. Bonus features: audio commentary with director Kirby Dick and producer Amy Ziering; extended interviews; Sundance post-screening speak out; VetWOW survivor retreat; PTSD therapy deleted scene. Note Extras: Audio commentary with director Kirby Dick and producer Amy Ziering; Regina & John Vasquez, extended interviews; Sundance Film Festival post-screening speak-out; Survivor retreat; Cowboy up - equine PTSD therapy. Awards Nominee, Best Documentary, Features (Kirby Dick, Amy Ziering), 2013 Academy Awards (U.S.A.); Sundance Film Festival, Audience Award; Seattle Film Festival, Audience Award; Human Rights Watch Film Festival, Nestor Almendros Award for Courage in Filmmaking. Language Closed-captioned. Subject Rape victims -- United States. Women soldiers -- Crimes against -- United States -- Interviews. Soldiers -- Crimes against -- United States -- Interviews. Sexual harassment in the military -- United States. Military Personnel -- United States. Rape -- United States. Crime Victims -- United States -- Interview. Sexual Harassment -- United States. Women -- United States -- Interview. United States -- Armed Forces -- Women. Genre/Form Nonfiction films. Documentary films. Feature films. Video recordings for the hearing impaired.
